inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getClient.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getClient.

addons.description: Addons enabled for this client and their associated configurations.

allowedClients.description: List of applications ID's that will be allowed to make delegation request. By default, all applications will be allowed.

allowedLogoutUrls.description: URLs that Auth0 may redirect to after logout.

allowedOrigins.description: URLs that represent valid origins for cross-origin resource sharing. By default, all your callback URLs will be allowed.

appType.description: Type of application the client represents. Possible values are: `native`, `spa`, `regular_web`, `non_interactive`, `sso_integration`. Specific SSO integrations types accepted as well are: `rms`, `box`, `cloudbees`, `concur`, `dropbox`, `mscrm`, `echosign`, `egnyte`, `newrelic`, `office365`, `salesforce`, `sentry`, `sharepoint`, `slack`, `springcm`, `zendesk`, `zoom`.

callbacks.description: URLs that Auth0 may call back to after a user authenticates for the client. Make sure to specify the protocol (https://) otherwise the callback may fail in some cases. With the exception of custom URI schemes for native clients, all callbacks should use protocol https://.

clientAliases.description: List of audiences/realms for SAML protocol. Used by the wsfed addon.

clientId.description: The ID of the client. If not provided, `name` must be set.

clientMetadata.description: Metadata associated with the client, in the form of an object with string values (max 255 chars). Maximum of 10 metadata properties allowed. Field names (max 255 chars) are alphanumeric and may only include the following special characters: `:,-+=_*?"/\()<>@ [Tab] [Space]`.

crossOriginAuth.description: Whether this client can be used to make cross-origin authentication requests (`true`) or it is not allowed to make such requests (`false`).

crossOriginLoc.description: URL of the location in your site where the cross-origin verification takes place for the cross-origin auth flow when performing authentication in your own domain instead of Auth0 Universal Login page.

customLoginPage.description: The content (HTML, CSS, JS) of the custom login page.

customLoginPageOn.description: Indicates whether a custom login page is to be used.

description.description: Description of the purpose of the client.

encryptionKey.description: Encryption used for WS-Fed responses with this client.

formTemplate.description: HTML form template to be used for WS-Federation.

grantTypes.description: Types of grants that this client is authorized to use.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

initiateLoginUri.description: Initiate login URI. Must be HTTPS or an empty string.

isFirstParty.description: Indicates whether this client is a first-party client.

isTokenEndpointIpHeaderTrusted.description: Indicates whether the token endpoint IP header is trusted. Requires the authentication method to be set to `client_secret_post` or `client_secret_basic`. Setting this property when creating the resource, will default the authentication method to `client_secret_post`. To change the authentication method to `client_secret_basic` use the `auth0.ClientCredentials` resource.

jwtConfigurations.description: Configuration settings for the JWTs issued for this client.

logoUri.description: URL of the logo for the client. Recommended size is 150px x 150px. If none is set, the default badge for the application type will be shown.

mobiles.description: Additional configuration for native mobile apps.

name.description: The name of the client. If not provided, `client_id` must be set.

nativeSocialLogins.description: Configuration settings to toggle native social login for mobile native applications. Once this is set it must stay set, with both resources set to `false` in order to change the `app_type`.

oidcBackchannelLogoutUrls.description: Set of URLs that are valid to call back from Auth0 for OIDC backchannel logout. Currently only one URL is allowed.

oidcConformant.description: Indicates whether this client will conform to strict OIDC specifications.

organizationRequireBehavior.description: Defines how to proceed during an authentication transaction when `organization_usage = "require"`. Can be `no_prompt` (default), `pre_login_prompt` or  `post_login_prompt`.

organizationUsage.description: Defines how to proceed during an authentication transaction with regards to an organization. Can be `deny` (default), `allow` or `require`.

refreshTokens.description: Configuration settings for the refresh tokens issued for this client.

requirePushedAuthorizationRequests.description: Makes the use of Pushed Authorization Requests mandatory for this client. This feature currently needs to be enabled on the tenant in order to make use of it.

signingKeys.description: List containing a map of the public cert of the signing key and the public cert of the signing key in PKCS7.

sso.description: Applies only to SSO clients and determines whether Auth0 will handle Single Sign-On (true) or whether the identity provider will (false).

ssoDisabled.description: Indicates whether or not SSO is disabled.

tokenEndpointAuthMethod.description: The authentication method for the token endpoint. Results include `none` (public client without a client secret), `client_secret_post` (client uses HTTP POST parameters), `client_secret_basic` (client uses HTTP Basic). Managing a client's authentication method can be done via the `auth0.ClientCredentials` resource.

webOrigins.description: URLs that represent valid web origins for use with web message response mode.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getConnection.

connectionId.description: The ID of the connection. If not provided, `name` must be set.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getConnection.

connectionId.description: The ID of the connection. If not provided, `name` must be set.

enabledClients.description: IDs of the clients for which the connection is enabled.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

isDomainConnection.description: Indicates whether the connection is domain level.

metadata.description: Metadata associated with the connection, in the form of a map of string values (max 255 chars).

name.description: The name of the connection. If not provided, `connection_id` must be set.

realms.description: Defines the realms for which the connection will be used (e.g., email domains). If not specified, the connection name is added as the realm.

showAsButton.description: Display connection as a button. Only available on enterprise connections.

strategy.description: Type of the connection, which indicates the identity provider.

auth0:index/getCustomDomain:getCustomDom.description: Data source to retrieve the custom domain configuration.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCustomDomain.

customClientIpHeader.description: The HTTP header to fetch the client's IP address. Cannot be set on auth0_managed domains.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

originDomainName.description: Once the configuration status is `ready`, the DNS name of the Auth0 origin server that handles traffic for the custom domain.

primary.description: Indicates whether this is a primary domain.

status.description: Configuration status for the custom domain. Options include `disabled`, `pending`, `pending_verification`, and `ready`.

tlsPolicy.description: TLS policy for the custom domain. Available options are: `compatible` or `recommended`. Compatible includes TLS 1.0, 1.1, 1.2, and recommended only includes TLS 1.2. Cannot be set on self_managed domains.

type.description: Provisioning type for the custom domain. Options include `auth0_managed_certs` and `self_managed_certs`.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getOrganization.

name.description: The name of the organization. If not provided, `organization_id` must be set. For performance, it is advised to use the `organization_id` as a lookup if possible.

organizationId.description: The ID of the organization. If not provided, `name` must be set.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getOrganization.

brandings.description: Defines how to style the login pages.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

members.description: User ID(s) that are members of the organization.

metadata.description: Metadata associated with the organization. Maximum of 10 metadata properties allowed.

name.description: The name of the organization. If not provided, `organization_id` must be set. For performance, it is advised to use the `organization_id` as a lookup if possible.

organizationId.description: The ID of the organization. If not provided, `name` must be set.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getPages.

changePasswords.description: Configuration settings for customizing the Password Reset page.

errors.description: Configuration settings for the Error pages.

guardianMfas.description: Configuration settings for customizing the Guardian Multi-Factor Authentication page.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

logins.description: Configuration settings for customizing the Login page.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getResourceServer.

identifier.description: Unique identifier for the resource server. Used as the audience parameter for authorization calls. If not provided, `resource_server_id` must be set.

resourceServerId.description: The ID of the resource server. If not provided, `identifier` must be set.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getResourceServer.

allowOfflineAccess.description: Indicates whether refresh tokens can be issued for this resource server.

enforcePolicies.description: If this setting is enabled, RBAC authorization policies will be enforced for this API. Role and permission assignments will be evaluated during the login transaction.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

identifier.description: Unique identifier for the resource server. Used as the audience parameter for authorization calls. If not provided, `resource_server_id` must be set.

name.description: Friendly name for the resource server. Cannot include `<` or `>` characters.

resourceServerId.description: The ID of the resource server. If not provided, `identifier` must be set.

scopes.description: List of permissions (scopes) used by this resource server.

signingAlg.description: Algorithm used to sign JWTs. Options include `HS256` and `RS256`.

signingSecret.description: Secret used to sign tokens when using symmetric algorithms (HS256).

skipConsentForVerifiableFirstPartyClient.description: Indicates whether to skip user consent for applications flagged as first party.

tokenDialect.description: Dialect of access tokens that should be issued for this resource server. Options include `access_token` or `access_token_authz`. If this setting is set to `access_token_authz`, the Permissions claim will be added to the access token. Only available if RBAC (`enforce_policies`) is enabled for this API.

tokenLifetime.description: Number of seconds during which access tokens issued for this resource server from the token endpoint remain valid.

tokenLifetimeForWeb.description: Number of seconds during which access tokens issued for this resource server via implicit or hybrid flows remain valid. Cannot be greater than the `token_lifetime` value.

verificationLocation.description: URL from which to retrieve JWKs for this resource server. Used for verifying the JWT sent to Auth0 for token introspection.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRole.

roleId.description: The ID of the role. If not provided, `name` must be set.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRole.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: The name of the role. If not provided, `role_id` must be set.

permissions.description: Configuration settings for permissions (scopes) attached to the role.

roleId.description: The ID of the role. If not provided, `name` must be set.

users.description: List of user IDs assigned to this role. Retrieves a maximum of 1000 user IDs.

auth0:index/getSigningKeys:getSigningKey.description: Data source to retrieve signing keys used by the applications in your tenant. [Learn more](https://auth0.com/docs/get-started/tenant-settings/signing-keys).

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getSigningKeys.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTenant.

allowOrganizationNameInAuthenticationApi.description: Whether to accept an organization name instead of an ID on auth endpoints.

allowedLogoutUrls.description: URLs that Auth0 may redirect to after logout.

customizeMfaInPostloginAction.description: Whether to enable flexible factors for MFA in the PostLogin action.

defaultAudience.description: API Audience to use by default for API Authorization flows. This setting is equivalent to appending the audience to every authorization request made to the tenant for every application.

defaultDirectory.description: Name of the connection to be used for Password Grant exchanges. Options include `auth0-adldap`, `ad`, `auth0`, `email`, `sms`, `waad`, and `adfs`.

defaultRedirectionUri.description: The default absolute redirection URI. Must be HTTPS or an empty string.

enabledLocales.description: Supported locales for the user interface. The first locale in the list will be used to set the default locale.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

idleSessionLifetime.description: Number of hours during which a session can be inactive before the user must log in again.

managementApiIdentifier.description: The identifier value of the built-in Management API resource server, which can be used as an audience when configuring client grants.

pictureUrl.description: URL of logo to be shown for the tenant. Recommended size is 150px x 150px. If no URL is provided, the Auth0 logo will be used.

sandboxVersion.description: Selected sandbox version for the extensibility environment, which allows you to use custom scripts to extend parts of Auth0's functionality.

sessionCookies.description: Alters behavior of tenant's session cookie. Contains a single `mode` property.

sessionLifetime.description: Number of hours during which a session will stay valid.

sessions.description: Sessions related settings for the tenant.

supportEmail.description: Support email address for authenticating users.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUser.

userId.description: ID of the user.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getUser.

appMetadata.description: Custom fields that store info about the user that impact the user's core functionality, such as how an application functions or what the user can access. Examples include support plans and IDs for external accounts.

blocked.description: Indicates whether the user is blocked or not.

connectionName.description: Name of the connection from which the user information was sourced.

emailVerified.description: Indicates whether the email address has been verified.

familyName.description: Family name of the user. This value can only be updated if the connection is a database connection (using the Auth0 store), a passwordless connection (email or sms) or has disabled 'Sync user profile attributes at each login'. For more information, see: [Configure Identity Provider Connection for User Profile Updates](https://auth0.com/docs/manage-users/user-accounts/user-profiles/configure-connection-sync-with-auth0).

givenName.description: Given name of the user. This value can only be updated if the connection is a database connection (using the Auth0 store), a passwordless connection (email or sms) or has disabled 'Sync user profile attributes at each login'. For more information, see: [Configure Identity Provider Connection for User Profile Updates](https://auth0.com/docs/manage-users/user-accounts/user-profiles/configure-connection-sync-with-auth0).

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: Name of the user. This value can only be updated if the connection is a database connection (using the Auth0 store), a passwordless connection (email or sms) or has disabled 'Sync user profile attributes at each login'. For more information, see: [Configure Identity Provider Connection for User Profile Updates](https://auth0.com/docs/manage-users/user-accounts/user-profiles/configure-connection-sync-with-auth0).

nickname.description: Preferred nickname or alias of the user. This value can only be updated if the connection is a database connection (using the Auth0 store), a passwordless connection (email or sms) or has disabled 'Sync user profile attributes at each login'. For more information, see: [Configure Identity Provider Connection for User Profile Updates](https://auth0.com/docs/manage-users/user-accounts/user-profiles/configure-connection-sync-with-auth0).

password.description: Initial password for this user. Required for non-passwordless connections (SMS and email).

permissions.description: List of API permissions granted to the user.

phoneNumber.description: Phone number for the user; follows the E.164 recommendation. Used for SMS connections.

phoneVerified.description: Indicates whether the phone number has been verified.

picture.description: Picture of the user. This value can only be updated if the connection is a database connection (using the Auth0 store), a passwordless connection (email or sms) or has disabled 'Sync user profile attributes at each login'. For more information, see: [Configure Identity Provider Connection for User Profile Updates](https://auth0.com/docs/manage-users/user-accounts/user-profiles/configure-connection-sync-with-auth0).

roles.description: Set of IDs of roles assigned to the user.

userId.description: ID of the user.

userMetadata.description: Custom fields that store info about the user that does not impact a user's core functionality. Examples include work address, home address, and user preferences.

username.description: Username of the user. Only valid if the connection requires a username.

verifyEmail.description: Indicates whether the user will receive a verification email after creation. Overrides behavior of `email_verified` parameter.
